conclusion: Determine the acceleration of the cargo and the time it takes to travel from the left end to the right end.
Cargo experiences a frictional force due to the difference in speed between the conveyor and the cargo.
Frictional force is given by f = mu_1 N, where N is the normal force equal to the weight of the cargo mg.
Normal force N is equal to the weight of the cargo mg.
Acceleration a of the cargo due to frictional force is a = f/m = mu_1 g.
Given mu_1 = 0.2 and g = 10 m/s^2, acceleration a = 2 m/s^2.
Cargo accelerates until it reaches the speed of the conveyor v_0 = 2 m/s.
Time t_1 to reach conveyor speed is t_1 = v_0/a = 1 s.
Distance d_1 traveled during acceleration is d_1 = 1/2 a t_1^2 = 1 m.
Remaining distance d_2 to be covered is d_2 = L_1 - d_1 = 5 m.
Time t_2 to cover remaining distance at constant speed is t_2 = d_2/v_0 = 2.5 s.
Total time t to travel from left end to right end is t = t_1 + t_2 = 3.5 s.
Acceleration of cargo when placed on conveyor is 2 m/s^2.
Time to travel from left end to right end is 3.5 s.
